name: arcibi
text: I like this one just because Lie Bot seems to be holding a paper airplane for no reason

name: abe
text: And he is wearing a pilots insignia.

name: jimbob
text:
Is he role-playing Frank Abagnale (Catch Me If You Can)?
Like megalomaniacs dress up as Napoleon.

name: dusty
text: I would expect such an astute observation to have more chubbies.

name: tekende
text: A comment left by tekende was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Dovey, indolent)

name: expellens
text: At least Phillipe has remembered NOT to tell a knock-knock joke when someone has had a gruesome accident.

name: soticoto
text:
No.
The cake is a lie.
The paper airplane is real.

name: greyfield
text: No, you see, he's prepared for Philippe to walk by to tell him a kick-ass lie, only to discover Philippe has no time for his shenanigans.

name: manxome
text: Yes, and now that I understand this, I may sleep well once more.

name: thicker
text: Around this time I posted on some message board that I loved Achewood but didn't really get this particular arc, Onstad replied along the lines of "yeah I'm not sure where I was going with that." Somehow his honesty made me love Achewood even more and in my opinion he has never dropped the ball since.

name: riazm
text: I wonder how come he doesn't post on the Acheworld more? Maybe he's busy, or still sick. Or maybe he just finds the idea kind of tacky.

name: overmedicated
text: Or maybe he's kinda busy makin' the strips and all. Be real with me baby.

name: riazm
text: It's true, people with worthwhile tasks have little to no input on webcomic comment systems.

name: overmedicated
text: Christ, look at how often I'm on here.

name: cailetshadow
text: This alt text would look great on a tombstone.

name: hamscout
text:
It's almost like an unfinished palindrome...
...wait! Maybe it's an early polyglot palindrome!

D'neirf da edad neir fa?

Does anyone speak jive?

name: straw
text: Or pidgin?

name: satellitetv
text: It's funny to hit random comic and come to this one, because I initially didn't realize Philippe was upset about the french fry, just that he was running around yelling.

name: heath
text: Five'd for being the first Achewood I ever read. Ah, the memories... Ah, the wasted hours at work.

name: darthemed
text: Everyone but Lie Bot is reading. Lie Bot has created a paper airplane, possibly using a page torn out of a book. Always the contrarian, that one.

name: cinderfella
text: It is a page from a book, but he has written in the margins. Written all small 'The patron saint of county fairs is Spider-man'.

name: deusoma
text: That's the greatest non-sequitor in the history of the English language.

name: charchar
text: The alt text seems to want to kepp the suspense going, yet it toys with my emotions.

name: snowman
text: I like the composition of this strip, something I normally don't think is necessarily a strong point of Achewood.

name: rowboat
text: Here's another example of compositional excellence. Kind of along the same lines.

name: snowman
text: True.  Nice.

name: arelladawn
text: This is high-concept graphic novelism man

name: puguglypress
text: No, it's automatically not, because it's in a silly webcomic and not some tome that isn't enjoyable.

name: aaron_haynes
text: I like this strip,  but I wonder whose help he wants, seeing as he runs past all of the major characters to this point.

name: origotoshi
text: He doesn't actually run past most of them I believe, it's just showing them being startled by his scream. And yes, I do realize I'm replying to a year-old post, but what the hey, it's not like I'm interrupting some current conversation.

name: lolsworth
text: A friend; a dead friend?
